column5: Figured I'd take my 5 year old down. I'm sure both of us would get a kick out of it. Anybody else been? With young kids?    Photos added Jan. 31st
I just saw that on Rick Mercer. didn't know it excisted looks great. I wanna go. Bet you'll have a good time
A pal of mine took his grandson down same age as your lad Rob and from what I understand the lad had a great time.
I just saw that on Rick Mercer. didn't know it excisted looks great. I wanna go. Bet you'll have a good time Ya my son asked me to back-up so we could watch the segment again.
I've never been, but my sister went recently and suggested I take my kids. Says it was great.

We took our 3 kids over the Christmas holidays. Well worth the trip down. The cost is very expensive. $30 per adult and I think $15 per kid plus parking ect.... Make sure you pack a lunch and bring a camera. You and your son will love it Im sure. The great lakes exibit was very cool. Giant Largies, brookies, pike ect.... oh, and the jelly fish exhibit was cool too.

Took our young kids and they loved it, as did I.   Would go again, to be honest.  Recommend going early in the day if it's possible for you, as the crowds were pretty heavy in the afternoon.  That was a month or two ago, so may have cooled off since then.

We went last week on Thursday. Arrived at 10am, along with 5 or so school buses full of kids. Great exhibits and quite a few guides to answer questions. Feeding the stingrays was cool to watch , and the crab pond where you could touch or pick them up was popular with the kids. Parking is right across the road and was $12 for 2 hours. I expected it to be more. The wife and I are both seniors so $15/each. Our daughter is disabled and got in free. Enjoyable morning.

I went myself without any kids and enjoyed it and there is lots of interactive stuff for the kids do along with the great fish exhibits only complaint is the food services area is far too small for the number of people that visit the attraction would recommend you bring some snacks of your own not to mention that its probably expensive I didn't even bother trying to get into the food area other than that had a great time and would go back anytime I will probably get a yearly membership soon. Enjoy!!  Kawartha Kev

I went with my then girlfriend back in October. $30 a ticket is a little expensive but it was amazing. I loved that I was able to see long nose gar and paddlefish, they have an area you can pet sharks, manta rays and horseshoe crabs. I'd say everyone has to go at least once.
Thanks gang. I figured it would be a slamdunk. I'll likely take him during the week when I'm off.
Great lakes exhibit!? I have to see this!!!!
For everyone on our forum I would say it's the highlight of the show. I wish that part were bigger.
Yea I heard it was pretty cool, I need to check it out!
Went down today. As suggested here, it was an exciting day.
very nice, glad you enjoyed it!

Went a few weeks ago. Went on a friday night after 7 which was perfect as there was very few people there. Heard it gets very crowded at other times. Even though it was a little expensive we had a great time and it is very well laid out. Some of the tanks should be a little bigger though for the size of the fish as the grouper tank was waaay too small for those giants.
